Located in Perrysburg, Trinity Natural Health is one of Ohio's few centers offering this cutting-edge technology. If you're looking for natural nerve support, reduced medication needs, or improved sensation without invasive procedures, EES may be worth exploring.

Understanding Peripheral Neuropathy

Peripheral neuropathy is damage to the peripheral nerves that often causes numbness, tingling, burning sensations, and pain, typically in the hands and feet. It can result from diabetes, chemotherapy, injuries, infections, or other causes.

Common Symptoms

  • Burning or tingling sensations
  • Numbness in hands or feet
  • Sharp, jabbing pain
  • Sensitivity to touch
  • Loss of balance and coordination
  • Muscle weakness

Traditional Treatment Costs

Doctor visits: $200-400 per visit

Medications (gabapentin, Lyrica): $100-400/month

Physical therapy: $150-300 per session

Nerve blocks: $500-2,000 per procedure

Topical treatments: $50-150/month

Limitations of Traditional Approaches

  • Medications mask pain but don't heal nerves
  • Side effects (drowsiness, weight gain, brain fog)
  • Often told nerve damage is "permanent"
  • Treatments focus on symptom management
  • Nerve regeneration rarely addressed

What is Energy Enhancement System (EES)?

Energy Enhancement System is revolutionary scalar wave technology developed by Dr. Sandra Rose Michael after decades of research in integrated biophysics. Unlike treatments that only manage symptoms, EES works at the cellular level to support nerve regeneration and function.

How EES Technology Works for Nerves

EES generates scalar waves that move at superluminal velocity (beyond the speed of light) to:

  • Support cellular regeneration in nerve tissue
  • Promote improved circulation to nerves
  • Reduce inflammation around nerve pathways
  • Support myelin sheath repair
  • Repair DNA breaks and lengthen telomeres (NASA research)

Scientific Backing

NASA research has shown that scalar energy fields repair DNA breaks and lengthen telomeres, providing scientific validation for EES technology's ability to support cellular regeneration, including nerve tissue.

Types of Neuropathy That May Benefit from EES

Diabetic Neuropathy

EES may support nerve function and reduce inflammation even in the presence of controlled diabetes, potentially helping with the burning, tingling, and numbness associated with diabetic nerve damage.

Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy

Following cancer treatment, EES may support cellular recovery and nerve regeneration, potentially helping restore sensation and reduce pain months or years after chemotherapy.

Idiopathic Neuropathy

When the cause of neuropathy is unknown, EES's cellular approach may help by supporting overall nerve health and function regardless of the underlying cause.

"I had diabetic neuropathy for several years. The burning in my feet was affecting my sleep and quality of life. After consistent EES sessions, I noticed gradual improvements - the burning reduced significantly and I regained some sensation I thought was permanently lost."

- Robert M., Perrysburg, OH

When Traditional Treatment May Be More Appropriate

We believe in transparent information. Traditional medical approaches may be better suited if:

  • You need immediate pain relief: Medications can provide faster (though temporary) symptom reduction.
  • You have acute neuropathy from injury: Recent nerve damage may require immediate medical intervention.
  • Underlying condition needs treatment: If neuropathy is from untreated diabetes or B12 deficiency, addressing the root medical issue is essential.
  • Insurance coverage is critical: Traditional treatments are more likely to be covered by insurance plans.

Can You Use Both?

Yes! Many clients use EES alongside traditional treatments. EES can:

  • Work alongside neuropathy medications safely
  • Support nerve healing while medications manage symptoms
  • Potentially allow gradual medication reduction under doctor supervision
  • Address cellular health while other treatments manage pain

Consider integrating EES with your current treatment plan, working with your healthcare provider.

Results are typically gradual and cumulative. The key difference from medications is that EES supports actual nerve healing rather than just masking symptoms.

Many clients gradually reduce medications as their nerve function improves, but always work with your doctor. EES has no drug interactions, so it's safe to use alongside medications.
